The white is totally see through. I loved it to fill all my Victorian nightgown dreams but…ultimately returned it because it was just to see through. Upper part fits except for the arm area . Just a tiny bit tight.  I’m a 36A .  It’s definitely lightweight. Feels like when spring first arrives and you want to wear something like this that’s flowy and comfortable.  I know I’m a weirdo. 😆 it’s very nice but for me it was too big on the lower part. Definitely if you are less then 36ish this will fit perfectly even for someone pear shaped.  I’m 38 on my hips and it had way too much room. Like 2 times my hip size.  just don’t dry it. Oh and the shoulder part other than the arm area was a little loose. My shoulders are a tiny bit over 15 wide. The material is rough, wrinkly and the lace is all puckered. I thought it would be better after washing but no luck. I don’t know what’s different, maybe the quality of fabric and lace is not the same as of all my others gowns. I just order another gown, I wanted to see if it will be poor quality too. This instantly became my favorite nightgown. It's comfortable, well made, really pretty, and the fabric seems substantial. I bought it in black, and am thrilled with it - it's so hard to find cotton nighties that aren't pastel or floral. I'm 5'3", and the length is perfect, just to the tops of my feet. The elastic in the wrists isn't overly tight, and the lace and ribbon trim is not itchy. The gown washed and dried with only minimal shrinkage and no wrinkling. My husband even likes it! This is probably the best nightgown I own, and I'm definitely planning on buying more if they produce other solid colors. My only quibble would be that I wish it had side-seam pockets, but I want pockets in everything. This is a very good value.

I am purchasing the overcoat but again, in the summer months when I garden or get the mail or packages at my front door I don’t necessarily want to wear the overcoat on top of the dress because in the summer it gets hot.
